directions: Heat the oil in a wok or a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and ginger and cook for about 30 seconds. Add cabbage and chile pepper. Stir quickly, mixing in garlic and ginger. Stir-fry until cabbage becomes translucent and volume is reduced by half, but without it losing texture, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in rice vinegar and salt.
ingredients: 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, peeled and thinly sliced
5 cups Taiwanese cabbage, leaves separated and cut into 1 1/2-inch squares
1 small red chile pepper, thinly sliced  (Optional)
¼ teaspoon kosher salt, or to taste
title: Stir-Fried Taiwanese Cabbage
